articles.title: Argentina's Massa 'more than optimistic' IMF reserve targets met

articles.description: Argentina's Lisandro Martinez and France international Raphael Varane have been Ten Hag's preferred centre-back partnership in recent games.
articles.content:

articles.title: ‘The UK seems to have imploded’: how world’s press sees Truss’s Britain
articles.description: Post-Brexit schadenfreude in Europe and warnings from US that new PM is ‘making UK look like Argentina’
articles.content:
The UK is beginning to look jinxed to some foreign observers as they review the wreckage of last week’s mini-budget.

articles.title: How China targets the global fish supply
articles.description: The Chinese ships since 2016 have operated off South America virtually all day, all year, moving with the seasons from the coasts of Ecuador to Peru and eventually to Argentina, where they have fished for what amounts collectively to more than 16,000 days already this year.
articles.content:
Rich and ecologically diverse, the waters around the Galápagos Islands have attracted local fishermen for centuries. Now these waters face a much larger, more rapacious hunter: China.
The Galápagos are part of Ecuador. And yet each year, growing numb... [10000 chars]

articles.title: Argentina corn planting being held up by drought, exchange says
articles.description: By Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, Sept 29 (Reuters) - Argentina's corn planting is well behind the pace of last year due to a prolonged drought, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Thursday, noting that 5.8% of the area expected for the cereal had been sown, 11 percentage points behind a year before.The South American nation is the world's No. 3 exporter of corn.
articles.content:
